column1: /*119. Department of Pharmacology, Toxicology and Virology.
/* RULES FOR 'HER'
/* lexrep
/* These rules distinguish between possessive pronoun and personal pronoun in > 90% of cases.
/* The default is ENArtPosspron+ENPathRelObj+ENPerspron_obj.
/*		3001. People made fun of her for trying to finish the book. Sitting down for a one-to-one meeting with her was like greeting a friend.
/*		3002. He told her a story. That's what he told her lately.
/*		3003. The first time that I saw her I nearly went off the road.
/*		3004. I have always been friends with her. She hoped people would not judge her harshly.
/*		3005. She had a problem with her knees.
/*		3006. Her first marriage took her to Canada.
/*		3007. A warrant was issued for her arrest.
/*		3008. The investigator felt that there was probably a correlating association with the onset of her increased respiratory problems. WRONG. We are very proud of her winning this award.
/*		3009. But a passenger told me it was her lifetime’s ambition to set foot on Delos.
/*		3010. I am disgusted by her reported comments and completely refute the allegation.
/*		3011. Fifi celebrated her 60th birthday in May.
/*		3012. She splashed out for her five metre Puffin badge.
/*		3013. She is expecting her second child in May.
/*		3014. The patient developed a serious cerebrovascular accident (stroke) of thrombolytic origin which left her disabled.
/*		3015. She was trying to finish her book.
/*		3016. Anyone interested in sponsoring her can contact the number below.
/* AT ALL
/* These rules detect cases where 'at all' stresses a negation. The default is preposition + adjective.
/*		795.	There was no wind at all that day. There was no natural indication at all of their inability.
/*		1226. that is not what these passages, which I read out at the beginning, were about - not at all.
/*		437. We can already see that attunement is not at all inside.
/*		3017.	Mario didn't call at all yesterday. It wasn't abnormally expensive at all for me. Now they are not thinking about civilians at all," he said.
/*		3018.	He was not friendly, not friendly at all in fact. Not abnormally expensive at all and not too small.
/*		435. They think we should simply try not to use plastics at all.
/*		3019. They want to establish real controls at all their borders, both on land and at sea.
/*		3020. They want to establish real controls at all of their borders, both on land and at sea.
/*		1225. Do they want you to vote at all before the elections?
/*		451.	Fuel costs force a second look at all farm production costs.
/* NEITHER
/*		1387. These people know neither J.K. Rowling nor her writings.
/*		3021. Allowing two proposals to continue could mean neither is built.
/*		3022. Businesses rightly ask whether Theresa May wants to stay inside the European Union’s single market or the customs union or neither.
/*		3023. But neither quite possesses the same cachet.

/*		1009.	A survey index reading of 50 is expected showing that the sector neither expanded or contracted during the month.  In December, the Office of National Statistics found that over 1.2 million people aged between 15 and 24 are neither in work, education or a training scheme.
/*		1017.	The physician stated that the patient never received oral corticosteroids nor was her fluticasone reduced.
/* EITHER
/*		3024.  She's either jumping on stuff or asleep. WRONG. No patient in either group had a transient or persistent (>10 min) SBP >220 mm Hg.
/*		3025. No change in lower body fat was observed in either group.
/*		3026. And the phrase screen time doesn't really apply, either, she said.
/*		3027. There were two options, and either was OK with me.
/*		3028. Either Contracting Party may denounce the Agreement by notifying the other Contracting Party.

/*		3029. He thought that either the patient probably had underlining renal impairment and the administration of etoricoxib triggered the development of nephrotic syndrome, or this was a de novo effect of the etoricoxib therapy.
/*		3030. There were two options, and either was OK with me.
/* RULES FOR 'DUE'
/*		2496. The CEO is due to retire in August. WRONG. He couldn’t not confirm or deny if this was due to use of toxins.
/*		2497. The increase was due to higher gold and copper prices.
/*		2500. The net loss was not due to operational reasons.
/*		2505. The company has been under pressure for a while due to disappointing results, especially in the US.
/*		2498. The company expects margins to decline due to product mix and a continued transition toward mass market levels.
/*		1732. It abrogates osteoclast formation and activity in vitro due, in part, to its specificity for c-fms.
/*		1581. It doesn't have any debt refinancing due until at least the middle of 2022.
/*		3031. The expropriation is under due process of law.
/* RULES FOR 'BACK'
/* basic lexrep
/*		3032. The charity wants MPs to back a campaign to improve the system.
/*		3033. It expects to write back a significant portion of the US$200 million. The thieves had tried to get in by bending back metal window guards.

/*		3034. The boy was admitted with back pains. But this couldn’t stop them from hitting the back of the net before half time. SHOULD_NOT_FIRE_IN. Her scarlet dress was finished off with a silver bag which set her back another £14.

/*		3035. Living in space can take its toll on an astronaut’s back. Biopsies of the right lower leg and mid back were performed. SHOULD_NOT_FIRE_IN. The visitors pulled one back at the start of the second half with a well placed free kick.
